sentences: Samuel Koontz Donahue (March 18, 1918 â€“ March 22, 1974) was an American jazz saxophonist, trumpeter, and musical arranger.
He performed with Gene Krupa, Tommy Dorsey, Benny Goodman, Billy May, Woody Herman, and Stan Kenton.
Donahue was born in Detroit, Michigan, United States.
It dissolved in 1951 when Donahue re-enlisted in the Navy to serve in the Korean War.
Stop Look Go And Listen To Sam Donahue (Prescott, 1958)
